New Records: Kyle Hendricks became the first Cubs pitcher in history to toss at least six innings while allowing two or fewer hits and one or fewer runs in a start at Coors Field, which opened in 1995.
Key Match Events: Kyle Hendricks helped the Cubs avoid the sweep against the Colorado Rockies in a 6-2 victory.
Michael Busch delivered the first multi-homer game of his career in Sunday’s win, part of a three-hit day for his third such game of the trip.
Jameson Taillon allowed two runs in six-plus innings in his start against the Rockies.
Post-Match Reflections: Kyle Hendricks reflected on his performance, stating it was one of the best he had all year despite not having great stuff.
Craig Counsell commented on Isaac Paredes' improved plate discipline and ability to extend at-bats.
Jameson Taillon discussed his approach to pitching at Coors Field, emphasizing the importance of throwing strikes and not being intimidated by the ballpark.
